whitelists.title: Whitelists
whitelists.description: Add, list, or delete from your Rejection Allowlist. These endpoints are being replaced with a series of functionally identical endpoints called /allowlists.

post.description: Adds an email to your email rejection allowlist. If the address is currently on your denylist, that denylist entry will be removed automatically.

email.description: an email address to add to the allowlist

comment.description: an optional description of why the email was added to the allowlist

schema.description: a status object containing the address and the result of the operation

email.description: the email address you provided

post.description: Retrieves your email rejection allowlist. You can provide an email address or search prefix to limit the results. Returns up to 1000 results.

email.description: an optional email address or prefix to search by

schema.description: up to 1000 allowlist entries

items.description: the information for each allowlist entry

email.description: the email that is allowlisted

detail.description: a description of why the email was allowlisted

created_at.description: when the email was added to the allowlist

post.description: Removes an email address from the allowlist.

email.description: the email address to remove from the allowlist

schema.description: a status object containing the address and whether the deletion succeeded

email.description: the email address that was removed from the denylist

deleted.description: whether the address was deleted successfully

post.description: Returns information about an export job. If the export job's state is 'complete', the returned data will include a URL you can use to fetch the results. Every export job produces a zip archive, but the format of the archive is distinct for each job type. The api calls that initiate exports include more details about the output format for that job type.

id.description: an export job identifier

schema.description: the information about the export

id.description: the unique identifier for this Export. Use this identifier when checking the export job's status

created_at.description: the date and time that the export job was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

type.description: the type of the export job - activity, reject, or allowlist

finished_at.description: the date and time that the export job was finished as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

state.description: the export job's state - waiting, working, complete, error, or expired.

result_url.description: the url for the export job's results, if the job is completed.

post.description: Returns a list of your exports.

created_at.description: the date and time that the export job was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

type.description: the type of the export job - activity, reject, or allowlist

finished_at.description: the date and time that the export job was finished as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

state.description: the export job's state - waiting, working, complete, error, or expired.

result_url.description: the url for the export job's results, if the job is completed.

post.description: Begins an export of your rejection denylist. The denylist will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named rejects.csv that includes the following fields: email, reason, detail, created_at, expires_at, last_event_at, expires_at.

notify_email.description: an optional email address to notify when the export job has finished.

schema.description: information about the rejects export job that was started

id.description: the unique identifier for this Export. Use this identifier when checking the export job's status

created_at.description: the date and time that the export job was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

type.description: the type of the export job - activity, reject, or whitelist

finished_at.description: the date and time that the export job was finished as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

state.description: the export job's state - waiting, working, complete, error, or expired.

result_url.description: the url for the export job's results, if the job is completed.

post.description: Begins an export of your rejection allowlist. The allowlist will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named allowlist.csv that includes the following fields: email, detail, created_at.

notify_email.description: an optional email address to notify when the export job has finished.

schema.description: information about the allowlist export job that was started

id.description: the unique identifier for this Export. Use this identifier when checking the export job's status

created_at.description: the date and time that the export job was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

type.description: the type of the export job

finished_at.description: the date and time that the export job was finished as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format, or null for jobs that have not run

result_url.description: the url for the export job's results, if the job is complete

post.description: Begins an export of your rejection allowlist. The allowlist will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named allowlist.csv that includes the following fields: email, detail, created_at.

notify_email.description: an optional email address to notify when the export job has finished.

schema.description: information about the allowlist export job that was started

id.description: the unique identifier for this Export. Use this identifier when checking the export job's status

created_at.description: the date and time that the export job was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

finished_at.description: the date and time that the export job was finished as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format, or null for jobs that have not run

post.description: Begins an export of your activity history. The activity will be exported to a zip archive containing a single file named activity.csv in the same format as you would be able to export from your account's activity view. It includes the following fields: Date, Email Address, Sender, Subject, Status, Tags, Opens, Clicks, Bounce Detail. If you have configured any custom metadata fields, they will be included in the exported data.

notify_email.description: an optional email address to notify when the export job has finished

date_from.description: start date as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

date_to.description: end date as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

tags.description: an array of tag names to narrow the export to; will match messages that contain ANY of the tags

senders.description: an array of senders to narrow the export to

states.description: an array of message states to narrow the export to; messages with ANY of the states will be included

api_keys.description: an array of api keys to narrow the export to; messsagse sent with ANY of the keys will be included

items.description: an API key associated with your account

schema.description: information about the activity export job that was started

id.description: the unique identifier for this Export. Use this identifier when checking the export job's status

created_at.description: the date and time that the export job was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

type.description: the type of the export job

finished_at.description: the date and time that the export job was finished as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format, or null for jobs that have not run

result_url.description: the url for the export job's results, if the job is complete

post.description: List the domains that have been configured for inbound delivery.

created_at.description: the date and time that the inbound domain was added as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

post.description: List the routes defined for an inbound domain or SMS program. Provide either domain or phone (not both).

domain.description: The domain to check (required if phone is not provided)

phone.description: The SMS program phone number (required if domain is not provided)

schema.description: the routes associated with the domain

id.description: the unique identifier of the route

pattern.description: the search pattern that the mailbox name should match

url.description: the webhook URL where inbound messages will be published

post.description: Add a new route to an inbound domain or SMS program. Provide either domain or phone (not both).

domain.description: An existing inbound domain (required if phone is not provided)

phone.description: The SMS program phone number - the TO number that receives inbound SMS (required if domain is not provided)

pattern.description: For email: the mailbox pattern (e.g., "mailbox-*"). For SMS: not used, the phone number is the pattern.

url.description: the webhook URL where the inbound messages will be published

schema.description: the added mailbox route information

id.description: the unique identifier of the route

pattern.description: the search pattern that the mailbox name should match

url.description: the webhook URL where inbound messages will be published

post.description: Update the pattern or webhook of an existing inbound mailbox route. If null is provided for any fields, the values will remain unchanged.

id.description: the unique identifier of an existing mailbox route

pattern.description: For email: The search pattern that the mailbox name should match. For SMS: the sender's phone number (FROM number).  Null to leave unchanged

url.description: the webhook URL where the inbound messages will be published; Validation: webhookexists

schema.description: the updated mailbox route information

id.description: the unique identifier of the route

pattern.description: the search pattern that the mailbox name should match

url.description: the webhook URL where inbound messages will be published

post.description: Delete an existing inbound mailbox route.

id.description: the unique identifier of an existing route

schema.description: the deleted mailbox route information

id.description: the unique identifier of the route

pattern.description: the search pattern that the mailbox name should match

url.description: the webhook URL where inbound messages will be published

post.description: Take a raw MIME document destined for a domain with inbound domains set up, and send it to the inbound hook exactly as if it had been sent over SMTP.

raw_message.description: the full MIME document of an email message

to.description: optionally define the recipients to receive the message - otherwise we'll use the To, Cc, and Bcc headers provided in the document

items.description: the email address of the recipient

mail_from.description: the address specified in the MAIL FROM stage of the SMTP conversation. Required for the SPF check.

helo.description: the identification provided by the client mta in the MTA state of the SMTP conversation. Required for the SPF check.

client_address.description: the remote MTA's ip address. Optional; required for the SPF check.

schema.description: an array of the information for each recipient in the message (usually one) that matched an inbound route

email.description: the email address of the matching recipient

pattern.description: the mailbox route pattern that the recipient matched

url.description: the webhook URL that the message was posted to

post.description: Begins the warmup process for a dedicated IP. The rest of your mail will be sent over shared IPs or other dedicated IPs in the same pool.

post.summary: Get Mailchimp Transactional Template Time Series
post.description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a Mailchimp Transactional template. Returns an empty array if the template exists but has never been used to send messages.

mc_template_id.description: the id of the Mailchimp template to get time series data for

schema.description: Array of hourly stats for the template

time.description: The hour as a UTC date string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:00:00 format

sent.description: The number of emails sent during the time period

hard_bounces.description: The number of emails hard bounced during the time period

soft_bounces.description: The number of emails soft bounced during the time period

rejects.description: The number of emails rejected during the time period

complaints.description: The number of spam complaints received during the time period

unsubs.description: The number of unsubscribes during the time period

opens.description: The number of emails opened during the time period

unique_opens.description: The number of unique opens during the time period

clicks.description: The number of URLs clicked during the time period

unique_clicks.description: The number of unique clicks during the time period

headers.description: optional extra headers to add to the message (most headers are allowed)

important.description: whether or not this message is important, and should be delivered ahead of non-important messages

track_opens.description: whether or not to turn on open tracking for the message

track_clicks.description: whether or not to turn on click tracking for the message

auto_text.description: whether or not to automatically generate a text part for messages that are not given text

auto_html.description: whether or not to automatically generate an HTML part for messages that are not given HTML

inline_css.description: whether or not to automatically inline all CSS styles provided in the message HTML - only for HTML documents less than 256KB in size

url_strip_qs.description: whether or not to strip the query string from URLs when aggregating tracked URL data

preserve_recipients.description: whether or not to expose all recipients in to "To" header for each email

view_content_link.description: set to false to remove content logging for sensitive emails

bcc_address.description: an optional address to receive an exact copy of each recipient's email

tracking_domain.description: a custom domain to use for tracking opens and clicks instead of mandrillapp.com

signing_domain.description: a custom domain to use for SPF/DKIM signing instead of mandrill (for "via" or "on behalf of" in email clients)

return_path_domain.description: a custom domain to use for the messages's return-path

merge.description: whether to evaluate merge tags in the message. Will automatically be set to true if either merge_vars or global_merge_vars are provided.

merge_language.description: the merge tag language to use when evaluating merge tags, either mailchimp or handlebars

global_merge_vars.description: global merge variables to use for all recipients. You can override these per recipient.

name.description: the global merge variable's name. Merge variable names are case-insensitive and may not start with _

merge_vars.description: per-recipient merge variables, which override global merge variables with the same name.

rcpt.description: the email address of the recipient that the merge variables should apply to

name.description: the merge variable's name. Merge variable names are case-insensitive and may not start with _

tags.description: an array of string to tag the message with. Stats are accumulated using tags, though we only store the first 100 we see, so this should not be unique or change frequently. Tags should be 50 characters or less. Any tags starting with an underscore are reserved for internal use and will cause errors.

items.description: a single tag - must not start with an underscore

subaccount.description: the unique id of a subaccount for this message - must already exist or will fail with an error

google_analytics_domains.description: an array of strings indicating for which any matching URLs will automatically have Google Analytics parameters appended to their query string automatically.

google_analytics_campaign.description: optional string indicating the value to set for the utm_campaign tracking parameter. If this isn't provided the email's from address will be used instead.

metadata.description: metadata an associative array of user metadata. Mandrill will store this metadata and make it available for retrieval. In addition, you can select up to 10 metadata fields to index and make searchable using the Mandrill search api.

recipient_metadata.description: Per-recipient metadata that will override the global values specified in the metadata parameter.

rcpt.description: the email address of the recipient that the metadata is associated with

values.description: an associated array containing the recipient's unique metadata. If a key exists in both the per-recipient metadata and the global metadata, the per-recipient metadata will be used.

attachments.description: an array of supported attachments to add to the message

type.description: the MIME type of the attachment

name.description: the file name of the attachment

content.description: the content of the attachment as a base64-encoded string

images.description: an array of embedded images to add to the message

type.description: the MIME type of the image - must start with "image/"

name.description: the Content ID of the image - use to reference the image in your HTML content

content.description: the content of the image as a base64-encoded string

async.description: enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

ip_pool.description: the name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

send_at.description: when this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately; for future dates, you're limited to one year from the date of scheduling.

post.description: Search recently sent messages and optionally narrow by date range, tags, senders, and API keys. If no date range is specified, results within the last 7 days are returned. This method may be called up to 20 times per minute. If you need the data more often, you can use /messages/info.json to get the information for a single message, or webhooks to push activity to your own application for querying.

post.description: Retrieves your email rejection denylist. You can provide an email address to limit the results. Returns up to 1000 results. By default, entries that have expired are excluded from the results; set include_expired to true to include them.

email.description: an optional email address to search by

include_expired.description: whether to include rejections that have already expired.

subaccount.description: an optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the denylist

schema.description: Up to 1000 rejection entries

items.description: the information for each rejection  entry

email.description: the email that is blocked

reason.description: the type of event (hard-bounce, soft-bounce, spam, unsub, custom) that caused this rejection

detail.description: extended details about the event, such as the SMTP diagnostic for bounces or the comment for manually-created rejections
detail.example: 550 5.1.1 The email account that you tried to reach does not exist.

created_at.description: when the email was added to the denylist

last_event_at.description: the timestamp of the most recent event that either created or renewed this rejection

expires_at.description: when the denylist entry will expire (this may be in the past)

expired.description: whether the denylist entry has expired

sender.description: the sender that this denylist entry applies to, or null if none.

created_at.description: the date and time that the sender was first seen by Mandrill as a UTC date string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

sent.description: the total number of messages sent by this sender

hard_bounces.description: the total number of hard bounces by messages by this sender

soft_bounces.description: the total number of soft bounces by messages by this sender

rejects.description: the total number of rejected messages by this sender

complaints.description: the total number of spam complaints received for messages by this sender

unsubs.description: the total number of unsubscribe requests received for messages by this sender

opens.description: the total number of times messages by this sender have been opened

clicks.description: the total number of times tracked URLs in messages by this sender have been clicked

unique_opens.description: the number of unique opens for emails sent for this sender

unique_clicks.description: the number of unique clicks for emails sent for this sender

subaccount.description: the subaccount that this denylist entry applies to, or null if none.

post.description: Deletes an email rejection. There is no limit to how many rejections you can remove from your denylist, but keep in mind that each deletion has an affect on your reputation.

email.description: an email address

subaccount.description: an optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the denylist deletion

schema.description: a status object containing the address and whether the deletion succeeded.

email.description: the email address that was removed from the denylist

deleted.description: whether the address was deleted successfully.

subaccount.description: the subaccount denylist that the address was removed from, if any

post.description: Return the senders that have tried to use this account.

schema.description: an array of sender data, one for each sending addresses used by the account

items.description: the information on each sending address in the account

created_at.description: the date and time that the sender was first seen by Mandrill as a UTC date string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

sent.description: the total number of messages sent by this sender

hard_bounces.description: the total number of hard bounces by messages by this sender

soft_bounces.description: the total number of soft bounces by messages by this sender

rejects.description: the total number of rejected messages by this sender

complaints.description: the total number of spam complaints received for messages by this sender

unsubs.description: the total number of unsubscribe requests received for messages by this sender

opens.description: the total number of times messages by this sender have been opened

clicks.description: the total number of times tracked URLs in messages by this sender have been clicked

unique_opens.description: the number of unique opens for emails sent for this sender

unique_clicks.description: the number of unique clicks for emails sent for this sender

post.description: Returns the sender domains that have been added to this account.

schema.description: an array of sender domain data, one for each sending domain used by the account

items.description: the information on each sending domain for the account

domain.description: the sender domain name

created_at.description: the date and time that the sending domain was first seen as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

last_tested_at.description: when the domain's DNS settings were last tested as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

spf.description: details about the domain's SPF record

valid.description: whether the domain's SPF record is valid for use with Mandrill

valid_after.description: when the domain's SPF record will be considered valid for use with Mandrill as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If set, this indicates that the record is valid now, but was previously invalid, and Mandrill will wait until the record's TTL elapses to start using it.

error.description: an error describing the spf record, or null if the record is correct
error.example: This domain has an SPF record, but it doesn't include Mandrill.

dkim.description: details about the domain's Legacy DKIM record

valid.description: whether the domain's Legacy DKIM record is valid for use with Mandrill

valid_after.description: when the domain's Legacy DKIM record will be considered valid for use with Mandrill as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If set, this indicates that the record is valid now, but was previously invalid, and Mandrill will wait until the record's TTL elapses to start using it.

error.description: an error describing the Legacy DKIM record, or null if the record is correct
error.example: does not match the required CNAME target of dkim1.mandrillapp.com. Please verify that the target was entered exactly as requested and try again.

dkim2.description: details about the domain's rotatable 2048 bit DKIM record

valid.description: whether the domain's DKIM record is valid for use with Mandrill

valid_after.description: when the domain's DKIM record will be considered valid for use with Mandrill as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If set, this indicates that the record is valid now, but was previously invalid, and Mandrill will wait until the record's TTL elapses to start using it.

error.description: an error describing the DKIM record, or null if the record is correct
error.example: does not match the required CNAME target of dkim2.mandrillapp.com. Please verify that the target was entered exactly as requested and try again.

dmarc.description: details about the domain's DMARC record

valid.description: whether the domain's DMARC record is valid for use with Mandrill

error.description: an error describing the DMARC record, or null if the record is correct
error.example: The record doesn't begin with a valid version tag.

verified_at.description: if the domain has been verified, this indicates when that verification occurred as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

valid_signing.description: whether this domain can be used to authenticate mail, either for itself or as a custom signing domain. If this is false but spf and dkim are both valid, you will need to verify the domain before using it to authenticate mail

verify_txt_key.description: a unique key used to verify a domain by adding a TXT record. Append this key to 'mandrill_verify.' and add it to your domain's TXT records to verify

post.description: Sends a verification email in order to verify ownership of a domain. Domain verification is a required step to confirm ownership of a domain. Once a domain has been verified in a Transactional API account, other accounts may not have their messages signed by that domain unless they also verify the domain. This prevents other Transactional API accounts from sending mail signed by your domain.

domain.description: domain name at which you can receive email

mailbox.description: a mailbox at the domain where the verification email should be sent

schema.description: information about the verification that was sent

status.description: "sent" indicates that the verification has been sent, "already_verified" indicates that the domain has already been verified with your account

domain.description: the domain name you provided

email.description: the email address the verification email was sent to

post.description: Get the list of subaccounts defined for the account, optionally filtered by a prefix.

sent_monthly.description: the number of emails the subaccount has sent so far this month (months start on midnight of the 1st, UTC)

sent_total.description: the number of emails the subaccount has sent since it was created

post.description: Add a new template.

name.description: the name for the new template - must be unique

from_email.description: a default sending address for emails sent using this template

from_name.description: a default from name to be used

subject.description: a default subject line to be used

code.description: the HTML code for the template with mc:edit attributes for the editable elements

text.description: a default text part to be used when sending with this template

publish.description: set to false to add a draft template without publishing

labels.description: an optional array of up to 10 labels to use for filtering templates

schema.description: the information saved about the new template

slug.description: the immutable unique code name of the template

name.description: the name of the template

labels.description: the list of labels applied to the template

code.description: the full HTML code of the template, with mc:edit attributes marking the editable elements - draft version

subject.description: the subject line of the template, if provided - draft version

from_email.description: the default sender address for the template, if provided - draft version

from_name.description: the default sender from name for the template, if provided - draft version

text.description: the default text part of messages sent with the template, if provided - draft version
text.example: This is the plain text version of the email.

publish_name.description: the same as the template name - kept as a separate field for backwards compatibility

publish_code.description: the full HTML code of the template, with mc:edit attributes marking the editable elements that are available as published, if it has been published

publish_subject.description: the subject line of the template, if provided

publish_from_email.description: the default sender address for the template, if provided

publish_from_name.description: the default sender from name for the template, if provided

publish_text.description: the default text part of messages sent with the template, if provided
publish_text.example: This is the plain text version of the email.

published_at.description: the date and time the template was last published as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format, or null if it has not been published

created_at.description: the date and time the template was first created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

updated_at.description: the date and time the template was last modified as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

is_broken_template.description: indicates if the template is malformed or corrupt

cname.description: details about the domain's CNAME record

valid.description: whether the domain's CNAME record is valid for use with Mandrill

valid_after.description: when the domain's CNAME record will be considered valid for use with Mandrill as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If set, this indicates that the record is valid now, but was previously invalid, and Mandrill will wait until the record's TTL elapses to start using it.

error.description: an error describing the CNAME record, or null if the record is correct
error.example: does not match the required CNAME target of mandrillapp.com. Please verify that the target was entered exactly as requested and try again.

valid_tracking.description: whether this domain can be used as a tracking domain for email.

post.description: Return the information about the API-connected user.

schema.description: the user information including username, key, reputation, quota, and historical sending stats

username.description: the username of the user (used for SMTP authentication)

created_at.description: the date and time that the user's Mandrill account was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

public_id.description: a unique, permanent identifier for this user

reputation.description: the reputation of the user on a scale from 0 to 100, with 75 generally being a "good" reputation

hourly_quota.description: the maximum number of emails Mandrill will deliver for this user each hour. Any emails beyond that will be accepted and queued for later delivery. Users with higher reputations will have higher hourly quotas

backlog.description: the number of emails that are queued for delivery due to exceeding your monthly or hourly quotas

stats.description: an aggregate summary of the account's sending stats

today.description: stats for this user so far today

sent.description: the number of emails sent for this user so far today

hard_bounces.description: the number of emails hard bounced for this user so far today

soft_bounces.description: the number of emails soft bounced for this user so far today

rejects.description: the number of emails rejected for sending this sender so far today

complaints.description: the number of spam complaints for this user so far today
